entry.title: Roseburg library offers free programs for families this fall
entry.summary: The Roseburg Public Library is gearing up for an exciting fall with a variety of youth programs.

entry.title: Roseburg Fire Department set to begin issuing residential burn permits on Oct. 1
entry.summary: ROSEBURG, Ore. - The City of Roseburg Fire Department is set to issue residential burn permits starting Oct. 1, and will be available until Oct. 31.

entry.title: Builder Sues Over Unfinished Senior Living Projects
entry.summary: A Sutherlin builder is suing the parent companies behind unfinished senior living projects in Roseburg and Creswell, claiming nearly $3 million in unpaid work. Dan Van Acker of Mars Construction alleges breach of contract and seeks foreclosure on the properties to recover costs.

entry.title: DFPA reduces fire danger levels
entry.summary: Sept. 30, 2025 6:50 a.m. The Douglas County Forest Protective Association decreased its fire danger levels on Monday afternoon. Public Use Restriction Levels have been downgraded to low for all private, county, state and Bureau of Indian Affairs lands within the Douglas District. The Industrial Fire Precaution Level has been lowered to Level 1 within...

entry.title: Roseburg Fire to begin issuing burn permits
entry.summary: Sept. 30, 2025 6:45 a.m. The Roseburg Fire Department will begin issuing residential burn permits on Wednesday. Permits are issued for a seven-day stretch and cost $75. Theyâ€™re available through Oct. 31. Call 541-492-6770 on weekdays between the hours of 8 a.m. and 5 p.m. to request a burn permit in the city of Roseburg....

entry.title: Roseburg teen plans Teen Mastermind Live
entry.summary: Malcolm Keith has spent the past 10 years attending business and entrepreneurial events and now he's hosting his own next weekend.

entry.title: Diamond Lake Resort Hosting First Fall Fling October 4
entry.summary: Diamond Lake Resort hosts its first Fall Fling Oct. 4, 9â€“5! ðŸŽƒ Start the day with the Monsters & Mimosas 5K (benefiting UCAN, use code â€œDiamondlakeâ€ for 10% off). Vendors, food, and â€œWitches & Ghouls on the Waterâ€ make it a full day of fun.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested on Felony Assault Charge
entry.summary: Roseburg Police arrested Justin Jones early Saturday on felony assault charges after he allegedly admitted to kicking a woman in the ribs. The victim reported difficulty breathing and feared broken ribs. Jones is held without bail at Douglas County Corrections.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested for Felony Strangulation
entry.summary: A 50-year-old Roseburg man, Royce Morgan, was arrested Sunday for felony strangulation, assault, and menacing after allegedly choking a woman and threatening to kill her. He is being held without bail at Douglas County Corrections.

entry.title: Though Fall Is Here, Fire Season Is Not Over
entry.summary: Though fall has arrived, fire season is not over. ODF warns fuels remain dry, east winds elevate risk, and most of Oregon is still at moderate to high fire danger. Debris burning is prohibited until season-ending rains arrive.

entry.title: Restrictions Decrease for Public and Industry
entry.summary: DFPA has lowered fire restrictions: Public Use is now Level LOW and IFPL reduced to Level 1 across the Douglas District. Debris burning remains prohibited. More at www.dfpa.net or call (541) 672-6507.

entry.title: Air quality advisory includes Western Douglas
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY â€” Oregon Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) and Lane Regional Air Protection Agency issued an air quality advisory Monday for Western Douglas and Western Lane counties.

The two men were reportedly arguing around 7:30 p.m. when the 41-year-old hit the other man in the face. RPD said there were no injuries reported...

entry.title: The Umpqua goes East: Melrose Vineyards begins partnership in Taiwan
entry.summary: Since the late 1800s, the Umpqua Valley has garnered a reputation as one of Oregonâ€™s premier wine regions, and possibly its oldest. Despite its popularity in the United States, Umpqua Valley wine is arguably not a world renowned product.

entry.title: Vaux's swifts return to Roseburg for fall migration

entry.title: RHS marching band takes first at regional competition
entry.summary: Sept. 29, 2025 6:45 a.m. The Roseburg High School Marching Band placed first out of 13 bands at a regional competition at Liberty High School over the weekend. The Douglas County Sheriffâ€™s Office announced that Shirley Hart had left her residence overnight Friday and had been reported missing. Hart suffered from dementia and was considered to be at risk. entry.title: Roseburg Forest Products lays off 107 employees, closes Dillard Hardwood Plywood plant
entry.summary: The "Timber Capitol of the World" was just hit by a major blow. One of the areaâ€™s major employers, Roseburg Forest Products laid off more than 100 employees last Thursday after closing one of its Dillard plants.
